name: East Asia in the World, 1600-Present
long_desc: The aim of the course is to provide a broad understanding of the place of East Asia in the world, and of the challenges that each state China, Japan, Korea has faced at home and abroad since 1600. Together we will examine the different ways the three states responded to internal and external crises and transformed into modern nationhood. We will also consider interpretations of the past that continue to impact how East Asians today perceive themselves, their countries, and international relations. Some of the topics covered will include globalization, imperialism, nationalism, scientific developments, and the role of historical memory as in Nanking, Hiroshima and the Korean War. Historical sources will include primary and secondary documents, pictures, films and memoirs.
